 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָחָר‎</span><sub>52</sub> **noun masculine**, used often as **adverb**, ==tomorrow, in time to come== (Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מְחַר‎</span> <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; probably properly ***time in front***, [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>ii. 263</sup>, compare √, and Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***ma—ru***</u></abbr>, ***front***, often of time, though always of ***former time, of old***, [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 402</sup>); — 

**1.** ***to-morrow*** (the day following the ***present*** day),
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** as ***substantive*** [[Exod.16.23|Exod 16:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָחָר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שַׁבָּתוֺן שַׁבַּת קֹדֶשׁ לְי‎</span> ***to-morrow*** is a sabbath, etc., [[1Sam.20.5|1Sam 20:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֹדֶשׁ מָחָר‎</span> ***to-morrow*** is the new moon, v[[1Sam.20.18|1Sam 20:18]] in <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יוֺם מָחָר‎</span> [[Gen.30.33|Gen 30:33]]; [[Prov.27.1|Prov 27:1]]; [[Isa.56.12|Isa 56:12]] in the idiomatic phrase <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּעֵת מָחָר‎</span> at the like of the time, (being) ***to-morrow, = about to-morrow*** (see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּ‎</span> **1 a**) [[Exod.9.18|Exod 9:18]]; [[1Sam.9.16|1Sam 9:16]]; [[1Sam.20.12|1Sam 20:12]]; [[1Kgs.19.2|1Kgs 19:2]]; [[1Kgs.20.6|1Kgs 20:6]]; [[2Kgs.7.1|2Kgs 7:1]]; [[2Kgs.7.18|2Kgs 7:18]]; [[2Kgs.10.6|2Kgs 10:6]] and in <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְמָחָר‎</span> [[Exod.8.19|Exod 8:19]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְמָחָר יִהְיֶה הָאֹת הַזֶּה‎</span>, = ***for, against, to-morrow***, [[Exod.8.6|Exod 8:6]]; [[Num.11.18|Num 11:18]]; [[Josh.7.13|Josh 7:13]]; [[Esth.5.12|Esth 5:12]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** as ***adverb accusative*** [[Exod.8.25|Exod 8:25]]; [[Exod.9.5|Exod 9:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָחָר יַעֲשֶׂה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>, [[Exod.10.4|Exod 10:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִנְנִי מֵבִיא מָחָר אַרְבֶּה‎</span>, [[Exod.17.9|Exod 17:9]]; [[Exod.32.5|Exod 32:5]]; [[Num.14.25|Num 14:25]]; [[1Sam.11.9|1Sam 11:9]] etc., [[Josh.11.6|Josh 11:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָחָר כָּעֵת הַזּאֹת‎</span>; opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַיּוֺם‎</span> [[Exod.19.10|Exod 19:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַיּוֺם וּמָחָר‎</span>, [[Josh.22.18|Josh 22:18]]; [[2Sam.11.12|2Sam 11:12]]a; rhetorically, [[Isa.22.13|Isa 22:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי מָחָר נָמוּת‎</span>. 

**2.** = ***in future time***, [[Exod.13.14|Exod 13:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי יִשְׁאָֽלְךָ בִנְךָ מָחָר לֵאמֹר‎</span> = [[Deut.6.20|Deut 6:20]]; [[Josh.4.6|Josh 4:6]]; [[Josh.4.21|Josh 4:21]]; [[Josh.22.24|Josh 22:24]]; [[Josh.22.27|Josh 22:27]]; [[Josh.22.28|Josh 22:28]] so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּיוֺם מָחָר‎</span> [[Gen.30.33|Gen 30:33]].
